info.title: EOD Historical Data API
info.description: Comprehensive OpenAPI Specification for the EOD Historical Data Service, merging abstract endpoints and detailed examples into a structured format with dynamic parameters. Find here the information about procing and Sign Up to obtain your API Key.

tags.name: Live (Delayed) Data
tags.description: Endpoints for live and delayed market data.

tags.name: Dividends and Splits Data
tags.description: Endpoints for accessing dividend and split data.

tags.name: Fundamental Data
tags.description: Endpoints for fundamental data of assets.

tags.name: Financial Calendar
tags.description: Endpoints for earnings and IPO calendars.

tags.name: Bonds Data
tags.description: Endpoints for bond fundamentals and EOD data.

tags.name: Exchanges
tags.description: Endpoints for exchange data and symbol lists.

tags.name: Stock Market Search
tags.description: Endpoints for searching stock market data.

tags.name: Sentiment Data
tags.description: Endpoints for sentiment analysis from news and tweets.

tags.name: Economic Events Data
tags.description: Endpoints for economic events and indicators.

tags.name: Macroeconomic Data
tags.description: Endpoints for macroeconomic data like bonds and exchange rates.

get.summary: Get End of Day Historical Quotes
get.description: Fetch historical end-of-day data for a specified ticker.

parameters.name: ticker
parameters.description: Ticker symbol for the asset (e.g., AAPL, TSLA).

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: Start date for the data in YYYY-MM-DD format.

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: End date for the data in YYYY-MM-DD format.

get.description: Fetch live or delayed data for a specified ticker.

parameters.name: fmt
parameters.description: Format of the response (e.g., json, csv).

get.description: Fetch dividend data for a specified ticker.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: Start date for the data in YYYY-MM-DD format.

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: End date for the data in YYYY-MM-DD format.

get.description: Fetch intraday data for a specified ticker.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: Start date or timestamp for the data.

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: End date or timestamp for the data.

get.description: Fetch fundamental data for a specific asset.
Fetch historical market capitalization data for a specific asset.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: Start date for the data in YYYY-MM-DD format.

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: End date for the data in YYYY-MM-DD format.

200.description: Successful response containing historical market cap data.

get.description: Fetch insider transactions data for various assets.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: Start date for the transactions in YYYY-MM-DD format.

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: End date for the transactions in YYYY-MM-DD format.

get.description: Fetch split data for a specified ticker.
Fetch technical indicators for a specified ticker.
Fetch the earnings calendar.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: Start date for the calendar in YYYY-MM-DD format.

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: End date for the calendar in YYYY-MM-DD format.

200.description: Successful response containing the earnings calendar.

get.description: Fetch financial calendar trends.
Fetch the IPO calendar.
Fetch fundamental data for a specific bond.

get.summary: Get Bulk EOD Data for Last Day
get.description: Fetch end-of-day bulk data for the last trading day for a specific exchange.

parameters.name: exchange_code
parameters.description: Code of the exchange (e.g., NASDAQ, NYSE).

parameters.name: date
parameters.description: Date for the bulk data in YYYY-MM-DD format.

parameters.name: fmt
parameters.description: Format of the response (e.g., json, csv).

200.description: Successful response containing bulk EOD data.

get.description: Fetch a list of all supported exchanges.

parameters.name: fmt
parameters.description: Format of the response (e.g., json, csv).

200.description: Successful response containing a list of exchanges.

get.summary: Get Symbol List for an Exchange
get.description: Fetch a list of symbols for a specific exchange.

parameters.name: delisted
parameters.description: Include delisted symbols (1 for true, 0 for false).

parameters.name: fmt
parameters.description: Format of the response (e.g., json, csv).

200.description: Successful response containing a list of symbols.

get.description: Fetch details about a specific exchange, including working hours and market holidays.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: Start date for the data in YYYY-MM-DD format.

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: End date for the data in YYYY-MM-DD format.

parameters.name: fmt
parameters.description: Format of the response (e.g., json, csv).

get.description: Fetch stock market screener results based on various filters.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Sorting order for the screener results (e.g., market_capitalization.desc).

parameters.name: filters
parameters.description: Filters for the screener results in JSON format.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of results to return.

get.description: Fetch search results for a specified symbol or name.

parameters.name: symbol_name
parameters.description: Symbol or name to search for.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of results to return.

get.description: Fetch sentiment data for specified symbols.
Fetch sentiment data from tweets for specified symbols.

200.description: Successful response containing tweet sentiment data.

get.description: Fetch economic events data.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of results to return.

get.description: Fetch financial news articles.

parameters.name: s
parameters.description: Symbol or topic to filter news.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of results to return.

get.description: Fetch data for a specific macroeconomic indicator.

200.description: Successful response containing macro indicator data.
